fields.description: As support for Bamboo Cloud will soon be over, an alternative is required for authentication between Bamboo On-Premise and the Atlassian suite in the cloud.

This advertisement page [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/core] mentions about the Board feature for Business project. This feature is specifically for JIRA Cloud version, but there is no explicit mention that it is only available in JIRA Cloud, and not JIRA Server. Only if the user clicks on _Try it Free_ link, then it directs the user to Cloud pricing page. This can be confusing for customer, expecting this to be available in JIRA Server as well. 

 

It is suggested to have this documentation improved in such a way that this page explicitly mention that this feature is only available in JIRA Cloud.
fields.summary: Explicit mention of JIRA Cloud for Core Board feature in advertisement page

fields.description:
Our documentation [Global Permissions Overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Global+Permissions+Overview] states:
{quote}To add permissions for a group:

First add the group to Confluence, if you have not already done so.
 Choose Edit Permissions. The 'Edit Global Permissions' screen appears.
 Enter the group name in the Grant browse permission to box in the 'Groups' section. You can search for the group name.
 Choose Add.
 The group will appear in the list and you can now edit its permissions.

To add permissions for a specific user:
 (Consider adding the user to a group and then assigning the permissions to the group, as described above, instead of assigning permissions to the specific user.)

First add the user to Confluence, if you have not already done so.
 Choose Edit Permissions. The 'Edit Global Permissions' screen appears.
 Enter the username in the Grant browse permission to box in the 'Individual Users' section. You can search for the username.
 Choose Add.
 The username will appear in the list and you can now edit its permissions.
{quote}
However, when you follow those steps, the "Grant browser permission" box is not displayed at all.

The correct way to do that in Cloud is by the following step-by-step:
 # Go to the Application Access part, under the administration ([https://DOMAIN.atlassian.net/admin/apps|https://domain.atlassian.net/admin/apps])
 # Then, head to the *View Configuration* ([https://DOMAIN.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig|https://domain.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig])
 # There, you will be able to see the current users/groups that already have permissions, which will be reflecting on your Global Permissions page.
 # Locate Confluence, and click on *Add group*, in the bottom of the page.
 # After adding the group, and granting the correct permissions, go back to the [Global Permissions of your instance|https://domain.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/permissions/globalpermissions.action] and you will see the group/user there. You just need to work with the remaining permissions.

Also, if you need to remove a user/group from the Global Permissions, you need to go to View Configuration ([https://DOMAIN.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig|https://domain.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig]) and uncheck the options that are checked. This will remove the user/group from the Global Permissions.

 

Please update the documentation accordingly to avoid confusion from our customers.
fields.summary: Document changes in Confluence Global Permissions in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, fixes and new features are implemented and released on a random basis which means users need to check every day if their Cloud applications have been upgraded or not. This is more problematic when waiting for fix releases for bug impacting Cloud products.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow Cloud administrators to receive notifications when products are getting an upgrade (mainly JIRA and Confluence) either as an email or as a pop-up notification when logging in after an upgrade.
fields.summary: As a Cloud administrator, I would like to receive a notification when my instance is upgraded
to verify the login page with valid data
to verify the login page with valid data
to verify the login page with valid data
Add the RANK field in card layout of SCRUM projects

fields.description:
h4. Description

Users want to be able to change how Lucene handle characters in other languages other than English, this can be very frustrating when searching issues in French, for instance, that contains words' like essais which can vary.

 
h4. Example

When searching for the word essais it should return all issues with the word even if it has a prefix.

e.g l'essais,j'essais,d'essais.

 
h4. Suggestion

Since the use of wildcards as the first character of a word in JQL search is not possible, make this option available for French and other languages.
fields.summary: Ability to switch the Lucene analyzer used based on the instance language setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While disabling a software project space blueprint, when creating a JIRA project with confluence space link , the loading doesn’t finish. 
 !Screen Shot 2016-11-04 at 11.16.21.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, disable “Software project space” in Space blueprints.
 # In JIRA, create a new software project with a tick of creating Confluence space linkage , Submit.
 # Pop-up appears to create the project and the space. 
 # The loading never ends. Only project creation succeeds, and space creation fails. 

h3. Expected Results

When disabling software project space blueprint, creating a space link in JIRA project creation will work with a blank space template.
 At least, needs an warning message which notify users, in the case. 
  
h3. Actual Results

The loading never ends and no message.
 Only project creation succeeds, and space creation fails. 
h3. Workaround

Users don’t select to create a space link when they create a software project, while disabling it.
 They just create a project and a space, separately in each application.
fields.summary: While disabling a space blueprint, creating a space linkage doesn’t work.
In old vers of JIRA was possible to Export "Excel current fileds". In cloud vers this is possible but only CSV format. Is this something you can add to the cloud version?
As a provider of CHAMPS, I want to be able to look up EHRs training session on the web site so that I can better serve my community

fields.description: The separate backlog for Kanban is great, but epic links don't appear in colour as they do on the main kanban board (or on the Scrum board). Having the epic links appear in colour makes it easier to scan the list for the different types of stories, etc.
fields.summary: Epic links appear in colour in Kanban Backlog cards

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Expiration dates of Cloud connect add-ons are showing incorrect expiration dates if compared to the actual expiration dates.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Not applied

h3. Expected Results
The expiration date of the add-ons in "Manage add-ons" page should reflect the dates the customer is seeing in the administrative system of Atlassian: my.atlassian.com for example.

h3. Actual Results
The expiration date is different and usually reflects an expired date instead.

h3. Workaround
Not available.
fields.summary: Expiration dates of add-ons showing incorrect numbers in JIRA Cloud instances

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Nowadays, if you're a project administrator, when you're selecting, for example, users to be added to a role, JIRA will display all users available at User Management. Customer would like to restrict the users that a project admin is able to insert into a role. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a group management feature where this group would limit users that each project administrator would be able to add into a role.
fields.summary: Restrict project administrators to add only specific groups

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 18 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

We apologize for the lack of updates on this request. Atlassian account has supported two-step verification since it was fully rolled out. Here's more information on [how to configure two-step verification for an individual Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/secure-your-account-with-two-step-verification-939505063.html].

Organizations can [require that all accounts at their company enable two-step verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/enforced-two-step-verification-938859738.html] with a subscription to [Atlassian Access|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access].

Regards,
Dave Meyer
Principal Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}

Will 2FA be included with the rollout of Atlassian Account later this month? Our organization is waiting to move to the cloud, but cannot do so until 2FA is enabled.

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 28 February 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. I wanted to share a short update – this request is not on our roadmap at this time. While we understand the desire to have consistent naming schemes within individual Jira or Confluence Cloud instance, users' full names are considering personally identifiable informations and are subject to the control of the end user. In the case that a user is a *managed account* of their organization (achieved via the domain claim process), the users' organization admin can also modify their public name. This is described in our [Privacy Policy|https://www.atlassian.com/legal/privacy-policy].

In cases where there is a strong requirement for control within a single Jira or Confluence Cloud instance, we recommend creating accounts for external users under a domain that is controlled by the company that owns the instance.

We appreciate your feedback. It's key to helping us understand how we can continue improving your experience with our products. 

Kind regards,
Dave Meyer
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Administrators of instances using Atlassian Account are requesting the option to edit users' full name even if their domain has not been claimed. This is important in situations that a user creates an Atlassian ID with a domain not owned by the administrator, and sets his full name to something not allowed on the instance or that will make difficult to search for that user. For example, it is possible to set the full name to the same as an existing user of the instance, which is unacceptable.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow site administrators to edit users' full name again. Another option would be to create a policy on the information not editable by the administrator. For example, one that prevents the user from setting his full name if it is already being used on the instance.

h3. Workaround 
A workaround would be to suggest that the user updates his full name, which may not be possible because relies on the users' cooperation.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to change users' full name (SSO)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When validating domains within JIRA, SSL is required. It would be extremely helpful if there was an option to validate domains not using SSL as not all customers have SSL configured within their domains.

h3. Environment
Cloud 1000.383.2


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into an instance
# Open User Management
# Click on the Domains link in the left hand menu
# Add a domain

h3. Expected Results
Clicking verify should validate the domain regardless of SSL being configured

h3. Actual Results
Security violation is shown and verification subsequently fails as SSL is not configured
fields.summary: As a JIRA Administrator, I would like the ability to validate domains that do not have SSL enabled / configured

Fabien

fields.description:
By default, JIRA haves a configured limit for the gadgets to be displayed in the dashboard in order prevent DOS attacks. However, in JIRA Server, we have the option to increase the number of gadgets in the dashboard by updating the *jira.dashboard.max.gadget* value, in the [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Advanced+JIRA+application+configuration] file. 

This is a feature request to allow the Cloud platform to have an option in the UI to change the gadgets displayed in the Dashboard.
fields.summary: UI Option to Increase Number of Gadgets Displayed on the Dashboard of JIRA

fields.description: Please implement showing 1 line commits similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-3536
fields.summary: BitBucket: Format commit messages in the commit list the same as git log --oneline

fields.description:
1. When closing a sprint, any  still-open issues should be added to the next sprint. They software should prompt for the name of the sprint and confirm the import of remaining issues from previous sprint. 

2. An issue should be able to be flagged as "include in next sprint" when it is created or subsequently added. We keep forgetting to add issues that we want done during our sprint planning because it's all completely manual.

Problem:
We are not able to integrate both applications directly on Cloud, we would like to have this feature just as Server environment

Solution:
Create a plugin to integrate both applications to have files from both accessible on Cloud environment.

Workaround:
Use [File Picker|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.inkfilepicker.plugin.confluence.filepicker]
fields.summary: Integrate Googledocs and Dropbox with Confluence/JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Atlassian Cloud Customers who utilize a Confluence-Only instance will receive an email from 'jira@domain.atlassian.net' for email notifications from User Management (such as Password Reset, etc)

h3. Suggested Solution
Send the email as "confluence", "Admin", or "Atlassian"
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Send Confluence-Only Instance Password Reset Emails from Confluence

fields.description:
This is a Feature Request to allow the top navigation menu options to be changed through the admin console in JIRA. 

In the Server options, we have the opportunity to edit bundled files and perform a customisation to achieve that. In Cloud, we could have an option in the administration console to change the titles for such options. For example, changing "Issues" to "Ideas". :)
fields.summary: Rename Navigation Menu Options via Administration Console

fields.description:
The following document contains a JIRA Server screenshot. The Server screenshot contains the 'Days in Column' checkbox which is a checkbox in card layout in the Cloud version:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARECLOUD/Configuring+columns

Today I received an email from Atlassian that they are going to remove the Configuration file from our JIRA instance. 

We have configured the absolute date as "DateTime" settings for our cloud instance. It plays a vital role in our day to day activities. So we request not to delete(remove) this configuration file from our instance (https://financialsoftwaresystems.atlassian.net). It will be  great difficult for us to traverse through the relative dates. 

If you are able to fix this absolute date settings by any other mean then there is no issues for us. Kindly make an alternate arrangement for the absolute date settings and then remove the configuration file. If  not then please do not remove the configuration file for our instance. 

Satish Kumar Jayaram
fields.summary: Retain the configuration file for JIRA Cloud instance

fields.description: We received feedback from customer saying that the bandwidth to download backup is very less. This makes the process to download large backup become very slow. It will be great if we can increase download bandwidth in order to make the download process faster.
fields.summary: Increase download bandwidth in order to be able to download large backup in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Certain functionality can be restored after a Cloud restart. End user (admin) has no way to trigger the restart without contacting Cloud Support

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide a button to restart instance if user is experiencing problems. 
 
h3. Workaround 

Contact Atlassian Cloud Support for investigation and a restart of the issue.
fields.summary: User would like the ability to restart cloud instance
